column2: # Read the table that I want to join with my sample_data
pupation_data <- read.csv("/Users/u_erazo/Documents/LABbook/2023/E1_23_Larvae_Temperature_Microbiome/Pupation_data/data/pupationdata_for_sample_table_all.csv", row.names = 1)
# Extract the sample_data into a data frame
metadata <- data.frame(sample_data(ps))
# Add a column for sample names
metadata$sample_names <- rownames(metadata)
# Remove row names from the metadata data frame
rownames(metadata) <- NULL
# Merge pupation_data with metadata by the column "pan_id"
merged_data <- merge(pupation_data, metadata, by = "pan_id")
# Convert the merged data frame to have row names based on the "sample_names" column
df_sample_data <- column_to_rownames(merged_data, var = "sample_names")
# Update the sample_data in the phyloseq object with the new data frame
sample_data(ps) <- df_sample_data
# Print the phyloseq object to check the result
ps
phyloseq-class experiment-level object
otu_table()   OTU Table:         [ 573 taxa and 330 samples ]
sample_data() Sample Data:       [ 330 samples by 28 sample variables ]
tax_table()   Taxonomy Table:    [ 573 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks ]
